title: General Knowledge Quiz
description: Test your general knowledge with these interesting questions covering various topics.

questions.question: What is the capital of Australia?
questions.explanation: Canberra is the capital city of Australia, chosen as a compromise between Sydney and Melbourne.

questions.question: Which planet is known as the Red Planet?
questions.explanation: Mars is called the Red Planet due to iron oxide (rust) on its surface giving it a reddish appearance.

questions.question: Who painted the Mona Lisa?
questions.explanation: Leonardo da Vinci painted the Mona Lisa between 1503-1519. It's now displayed in the Louvre Museum in Paris.

questions.question: What is the largest ocean on Earth?
questions.explanation: The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean, covering more than 30% of Earth's surface.

questions.question: Which element has the chemical symbol 'O'?
questions.explanation: Oxygen has the chemical symbol 'O' and atomic number 8. It's essential for respiration.

questions.question: In which year did World War II end?
questions.explanation: World War II ended in 1945 with the surrender of Japan on September 2, 1945.

questions.question: What is the smallest country in the world?
questions.explanation: Vatican City is the smallest country in the world, covering only 0.17 square miles.

questions.question: Which animal is known as the 'King of the Jungle'?
questions.explanation: The lion is often called the 'King of the Jungle' due to its majestic appearance and dominant nature.

questions.question: What is the currency of Japan?
questions.explanation: The Japanese Yen (Â¥) is the official currency of Japan.

questions.question: Which mountain is the highest in the world?
questions.explanation: Mount Everest is the highest mountain in the world at 8,848 meters (29,029 feet) above sea level.

questions.question: Who wrote 'Romeo and Juliet'?
questions.explanation: William Shakespeare wrote the famous tragedy 'Romeo and Juliet' in the late 16th century.

questions.question: What is the speed of light in a vacuum?
questions.explanation: The speed of light in a vacuum is exactly 299,792,458 meters per second.

questions.question: Which country is known as the 'Land of the Rising Sun'?
questions.explanation: Japan is known as the 'Land of the Rising Sun' due to its location east of the Asian mainland.

questions.question: What is the largest mammal in the world?
questions.explanation: The blue whale is the largest mammal and the largest animal ever known to have lived on Earth.

questions.question: Which gas makes up most of Earth's atmosphere?
questions.explanation: Nitrogen makes up about 78% of Earth's atmosphere, while oxygen makes up about 21%.
